item.title: Microsoft fixes Exchange Online bug flagging Gmail emails as spam
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​Microsoft has resolved an issue with a machine learning model that mistakenly flagged emails from Gmail accounts as spam in Exchange Online. [...]

item.title: Microsoft makes all new accounts passwordless by default
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft has announced that all new Microsoft accounts will be "passwordless by default" to secure them against password attacks such as phishing, brute force, and credential stuffing. [...]

item.title: Hacker 'NullBulge' pleads guilty to stealing Disney's Slack data
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: A California man who used the alias "NullBulge" has pleaded guilty to illegally accessing Disney's internal Slack channels and stealing over 1.1 terabytes of internal company data. [...]

item.title: Pro-Russia hacktivists bombard Dutch public orgs with DDoS attacks
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Russia-aligned hacktivists persistently target key public and private organizations in the Netherlands with distributed denial of service (DDoS) attacks, causing access problems and service disruptions. [...]

item.title: Ukrainian extradited to US for Nefilim ransomware attacks
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: A Ukrainian national has been extradited from Spain to the United States to face charges over allegedly conducting Nefilim ransomware attacks against companies. [...]

item.title: Harrods the next UK retailer targeted in a cyberattack
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: London's iconic department store, Harrods, has confirmed it was targeted in a cyberattack, becoming the third major UK retailer to report cyberattacks in a week following incidents at M&S and the Co-op. [...]

item.title: Malicious PyPI packages abuse Gmail, websockets to hijack systems
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Seven malicious PyPi packages were found using Gmail's SMTP servers and WebSockets for data exfiltration and remote command execution. [...]

item.title: Hackers abuse IPv6 networking feature to hijack software updates
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: A China-aligned APT threat actor named "TheWizards" abuses an IPv6 networking feature to launch adversary-in-the-middle (AitM) attacks that hijack software updates to install Windows malware. [...]

item.title: WordPress plugin disguised as a security tool injects backdoor
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A new malware campaign targeting WordPress sites employs a malicious plugin disguised as a security tool to trick users into installing and trusting it. [...]

item.title: WhatsApp unveils 'Private Processing' for cloud-based AI features
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: WhatsApp has announced the introduction of 'Private Processing,' a new technology that enables users to utilize advanced AI features by offloading tasks to privacy-preserving cloud servers. [...]

item.title: SonicWall warns of more VPN flaws exploited in attacks
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Cybersecurity company SonicWall has warned customers that two older vulnerabilities impacting its Secure Mobile Access (SMA) appliances are now being actively exploited in attacks. [...]

item.title: Commvault says recent breach didn't impact customer backup data
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Commvault, a leading provider of data protection solutions, says a nation-state threat actor who breached its Azure environment didn't gain access to customer backup data. [...]
